intro: Syringodea linnaeoides, commonly known as the false lily of the valley, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as woodland undergrowth. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Syringodea linnaeoides is native to parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates.
